results.name: Triangle read by rows of coefficients in expansion of (3-2x)^n, where n is a nonnegative integer.
comment: This is a signed version of A038220.
Row n gives coefficients in expansion of (3-2x)^n.
The numbers in rows of triangles in A302747 and A303941 are along skew diagonals pointing top-left and top-right in center-justified triangle of coefficients in expansions of (3-2x)^n (A303901).
This is the lower triangular Riordan matrix (1/(1 - 3*t), -2*t/(1-3*t), hence a convolution matrix.See the g.f.s. - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Jun 28 2018
reference: Shara Lalo and Zagros Lalo, Polynomial Expansion Theorems and Number Triangles, Zana Publishing, 2018, ISBN: 978-1-9995914-0-3, pp. 394, 396, 398.
link: Zagros Lalo, Skew Diagonals in center-justified Triangle
formula: G.f. of row polynomials: 1 / (1 - 3t + 2t x).G.f. of column k: (-2*x)^k/(1-3*x)^(k+1), for k >= 0.
xref: Cf. A013620 (unsigned), A000012 (row sums), A000351 (alternating row sums).
